items.title: November consumer prices rose at a 2.7% annual rate, lower than expected, delayed data shows
items.description: Economists polled by Dow Jones expected CPI to have risen 3.1% on an annualized basis.

items.title: Bank of England cuts interest rates, in welcome Christmas boost for consumers
items.description: The Bank of England voted to cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75% in its last monetary policy move of 2025.

items.title: November's inflation report is the first to be released after the shutdown. Here's what to expect
items.description: November's CPI report is expected to show the annual inflation rate at 3.1%, according to economists polled by Dow Jones.

items.title: Watch Fed Governor Christopher Waller speak on interest rates and the race to succeed Powell
items.description: Waller is one of the five finalists considered for to replace Fed Chairman Jerome Powell when his term expires in May.

items.title: Hassett says Fed independence is ‘really important’ and chair candidates shouldn’t be disqualified for being Trump’s friend
items.description: Hassett declined in a CNBC interview to directly address his own candidacy but said forging consensus is an important part of the job.
